etymology.description: semantic: 氵(氵) (shuǐ, 'water') + phonetic: 將(将) (jiāng, 'lead') = thick water-based substance -> thick liquid; starch; broth
etymology.interpretation: The character 浆(漿) (jiāng, 'thick liquid') combines the water radical 氵(氵) (shuǐ, 'water'), which suggests a liquid, with the phonetic component 將(将) (jiāng, 'lead'), to convey the idea of a water-based liquid that is thicker, such as broth or starch.
etymology.simplification: 漿(漿)→浆(漿): Simplified by reducing 將(将) (jiāng, 'lead') to the left component 几(几) (jī, 'small table'), retaining the similar phonetic reading.

examples.chinese: 这碗汤加了玉米浆(這碗湯加了玉米漿)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè wǎn tāng jiā le yùmǐ jiāng.
examples.english: This bowl of soup has added corn starch.

examples.chinese: 厨师先将玉米浆和面粉混合(廚師先將玉米漿和麵粉混合)，后加入鸡汤煮制浓汁(後加入雞湯煮製濃汁)。
examples.pinyin: Chúshī xiān jiāng yùmǐ jiāng hé miàn fěn hùn hé, hòu jiā rù jī tāng zhǔ zhì nóng zhī.
examples.english: The chef first mixes corn starch with flour, then adds chicken broth to cook a rich sauce.
